alert.note: Alert for Appling; Bacon; Brantley; Northeastern Charlton; Northern Ware; Pierce; Wayne; Western Charlton (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 11 at 10:51PM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PIERCE...BRANTLEY...CENTRAL WARE...SOUTHEASTERN BACON...SOUTHWESTERN WAYNE...NORTHWESTERN CHARLTON AND SOUTH CENTRAL APPLING COUNTIES THROUGH 1145 PM EDT... At 1051 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of strong thunderstorms near Jamestown, or 7 miles northwest of Blackshear, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts around 40 mph and minor flooding due to heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor flooding due to heavy rainfall is possible. Locations impacted include... Waycross, Blackshear, Nahunta, Patterson, Screven, Offerman, Hickox, Boggy Bay, Pebble Hill, and Raybon. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Appling; Bacon; Brantley; Northeastern Charlton; Northern Ware; Pierce; Wayne; Western Charlton
